examples: The edges of the wound coalesced.

definition: to unite into a whole : fuse
examples: separate townships have coalesced into a single, sprawling colony

definition: to unite for a common end : join forces
examples: people with different points of view coalesce into opposing factions

definition: to arise from the combination of distinct elements
examples: an organized and a popular resistance immediately coalesced
sometimes a book coalesces a public into a mass market
